intro: Weinmannia ouaiemensis, commonly known as the Ouaiemensis weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree, adapting to the shaded conditions of its natural habitat. Its leaves are often arranged in a whorled pattern, contributing to its ornamental appeal in horticultural settings.
